title: Rebecca Judd reveals she has added 'final piece of the puzzle' to $7.3 million Melbourne mansion
text:
They've just moved into their $7.3 million Melbourne mansion following extensive renovations.

And this week, AFL WAG Rebecca Judd revealed that she and husband Chris have added 'the final piece of the puzzle' to their Spanish Colonial-style home.

Speaking to Nine Honey, the 36-year-old said they have just installed large black steel windows.

'It's nice seeing your vision come to life': Rebecca Judd has revealed that she and her AFL star husband Chris have added 'the final piece of the puzzle' to their $7.3 million Melbourne mansion after months of extensive renovations

Lavish: Speaking to Nine Honey, the 36-year-old said they have just installed large black steel windows (pictured L before and R after)

'It's nice seeing your vision come to life,' Bec explains.

'Those arches at the back, which were originally a garden feature — as soon as I saw them, I knew we needed to extend the house out to those arches and put some steel windows in that would open out on to the tennis court.'

Despite the final touches, Bec said that the family are still not settled in completely just yet.

'I think it takes a few months to settle into a house before you stop feeling like a visitor,' Rebecca said.

It's still new! Despite the final touches, Bec said that the family are still not settled in completely just yet (pictured with husband Chris)

She added that they still have little things to do around the house, like getting some gates installed, but it's nearing completion.

Bec and Chris and their family moved into the home at the end of September.

The brunette beauty made headlines in June when she revealed that the home's garage wasn't big enough to house her Range Rover.

Extensive: She added that they still have little things to do around the house, like getting some gates installed, but it's nearing completion (pictured before)

New digs: Bec and Chris and their family moved into the home at the end of September

Talking to KIIS FM's Jase & PJ, Bec said she couldn't even fit the front of her luxury car inside the garage and that she and Chris had to spend $50,000 expanding the space.

'When you go to home inspections, you never think to drive your cars into the garage to see if they fit or not,' she admitted.

She then urged the radio show's listeners to 'measure the garage'.
description: They've just moved into their $7.3 million Melbourne mansion, after extensive renovations.
authors: Chloe-Lee Longhetti For Daily Mail Australia
